Package org.fluidity.deployment.osgi

Managed component model for OSGi services, and components depending thereon.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BundleBoundary
    Enables controlled cross-bundle class loading in an OSGi container.
    BundleComponents
    Bundle components with managed life cycle.
    BundleComponents.Managed
    A managed component that will be discovered and added to the bundle's container.
    BundleComponents.Registration
    An OSGi service that will be registered when started and un-registered when stopped by its managing container.
    BundleComponents.Registration.Listener<T>
    An OSGi service registration listener.
    BundleComponents.Status
    OSGi service to query about managed component states in this bundle.
    BundleComponents.Stoppable
    Super-interface for the various managed component interfaces.
    Initialization
    Optional components for a standalone OSGi application to initialize the OSGi framework after it has been started but before any of the bundles have.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Service
    Annotates method parameters of a BundleComponents.Managed component that require an OSGi service instance to resolve.
    Service.Type
    Specifies the OSGi service interfaces to register a service as.

Package org.fluidity.deployment.osgi Description

Managed component model for OSGi services, and components depending thereon.

Fluid Tools improves the basic service management in OSGi with dependency injected component management based on the OSGi bundle and service life cycle.

To take advantage of these improvements, implement your bundle as a collection of BundleComponents.Managed, BundleComponents.Registration and BundleComponents.Registration.Listener components.

Bundle life cycle observers are also recognized as @ComponentGroup annotated BundleActivator components.

Managed component status can be queried using the BundleComponents.Status OSGi service that each bundle running managed components exports.

OSGi application initialization can also be influenced by implementing Initialization.
